Summer Camp 2020 Update -

When we began developing protocols to work within the COVID-19 guidelines, we knew there would be challenges. As a team, we have worked tirelessly to come up with creative and safe solutions to continue to satisfy our mission of creating a safe, challenging, and engaging environment for our community's youth.

Despite these efforts, due to an exceptionally low (albeit not surprising) response rate for registration, we have had to make the difficult decision to cancel the Summer Programming for 2020.

We are fully committed to finding ways this year to provide programming where possible as the current landscape continues to evolve.

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us.

Just a reminder that our meal service providers will be getting a much needed break this week, and our food services will be CLOSED through Friday of this week. If you need food services during this closure, the Gardner CAC Food Pantry (294 Pleasant Street) is open Monday-Friday from 9 a.m.-12 p.m. and Growing Places will have their Mobile Food Cart at Parker Street (across from Gardner Ale House) this Friday and next Friday from 10-11a.m. and at GFA (67 Pearson Boulevard) on Tuesday, June 30 from 11 a.m.-12 p.m.

Starting Monday, July 6th, we will begin serving meals through a MOBILE meals model. We've been serving meals during the COVID-19 emergency response, and plan to keep our stationary sites OPEN during the summer, but will also have a new mobile meals van, which was grant-funded through Project Bread and the state's Summer Food Service Program Grant! These sites will be open at the times listed Monday through Friday from July 6th through August 14th.

Though many of you received a OneCall from Superintendent Pellegrino last night, we'd like to share some updates here:

First, as requested by an overwhelming percentage of families and teachers, the school committee voted Monday at their Zoom meeting to cancel April vacation. Essentially, we will observe the Patriots Day Holiday on Monday, April 20th, and then students will return to their routine of participating in remote learning activities from Tuesday, April 21st, through Friday, April 24th. This will result in an extended summer with the last day of school as Friday, June 19th.

Secondly, we want to be sure everyone is aware that the Massachusetts Commissioner of Elementary and Secondary Education has canceled the MCAS for all students, in all grades this year.

Please reach out if you have any questions! Thank you for all of your patience and support during this time.

We have received notification from MWCC that they are temporarily closing the college today and Monday in order to do a “deep cleaning”. According to a letter from the Mount’s president, Jim Vanderhooven, an MWCC employee reported that they had exposure to an individual with flu-like symptoms who has been placed into self-quarantine. The MWCC employee remains symptom-free, but out of an abundance of caution, will also remain in self-quarantine through the end of a 14-day period, as requested by the Department of Public Health. Per protocol, the State Department of Health was notified and they determined that no employees of MWCC who have had contact with this employee are at risk. The decision to use today, the weekend, and Monday to clean the campus is precautionary.

We are sharing this information because our Early College students as and Rise V students attend school on the MWCC campus. At this time, there is no indication that any of them were exposed to the virus. We have been in direct contact with the MWCC president and are continuing to monitor this situation closely.

October 21, 2019 at 11:23 AM ·

Last Call! 📣 FREE 💲TOWARD COLLEGE COURSE for High School Juniors and Seniors!

MWCC is celebrating STEM Week by giving away scholarship money to High School Juniors and Seniors!

Submit a 700-word essay including an explanation of how you believe Earth’s climate will affect you during your lifetime, for example- health, employment or community challenges/responsibilities and win! Be sure to include why you are interested or may want to work in the STEM field.

THREE SCHOLARSHIPS will be awarded: One (1) $500 scholarship toward a dual enrollment course during high school or toward MWCC certificate or degree program upon high school graduation.

Two (2) $250 scholarships toward a dual enrollment course during high school or toward MWCC certificate or degree program upon high school graduation.

Submit your essay to Essay@mwcc.mass.edu prior to Wednesday, October 23 at 5:00pm.
# massstemweek
